review: Xyzal (levocetirizine):I was a happy go lucky person and nothing in the world had bothered me whatsoever. I was on Certizine and it made me tired so I started to take Xyzal. It worked well at first then I noticed a change. I couldn’t sleep until about 2-3 in the morning. I was always irritated and paranoid about every little thing. One day I had a complete anxiety and panic breakdown. I thought that it was something different but after the reviews I realized it was the allergy medication. It made me believe it that it was something else and it wasn’t. I don’t recommend this medication at all.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Did the research. Xyzal appeared to be recommended for a runny nose due to cold and/or allergies. Supposed to give 24 hour relief. This I assume means a taper into relief and a taper off toward the end of 24 hours. Both my partner and myself took a pill. About an hour later felt some relief, which lasted for 3 hours. At that point it simply quit working....for both of us!
Xyzal (levocetirizine):I take Xyzal which is good but I’ve noticed that I get extremely depressed when I take it. I’m going to try and lay off it till see if this is what’s causing my mood swings.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):So it seems like a lot of people have had bad experiences with this medication and have taken it over the counter.  I got a prescription and spoke with a doctor before taking it so I was aware of some side effects.  The first few days were bad.  I did experience the additional sleepiness and some bouts of rage and depression.  I spoke with the doctor again and they mentioned to try and stay on it for a week and see if the symptoms subside and they did.  I am 3 weeks in now and it has helped my allergies a ton and the side effects are gone. I am feeling great.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have seasonal allergies and decided to try Xyzal, taking 1 pill at bedtime. It worked well for my allergies, but I woke up feeling groggy and fought drowsiness all day. By the afternoon, I took a 2 hour nap. It’s evening, now, and I still feel wonky. I think I’ll stick to Claritin.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):This drug made me completely crazy. I started having bad anxiety, then anger and depression. Very bad depression. Horrible headache and fatigue. I lashed out at a coworker and got in trouble. What a disaster. Never again. Going back to Zyrtec.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have been taking xyzal for 2 days now. I have had a constant post nasal drip since I quit smoking about 6 months ago. Tried EVERYTHING from humidifiers to nasal rinses, mucinex and sudafed, steroid nose sprays and elevating my head. I've been to the doctor multiple times with no answers and this is the only thing that makes it not feel like a lump of gunk isn't stuck in the back of my throat. I have been so miserable coughing up nasties every night. The downsides: gives me heartburn (a lot of things do so it's not a surprise) so I have to take tums with it. It also makes me VERY drowsy, so I take it an hour before bed and then go to sleep.

So usually I take fexofenadine but its on the more expensive side for me so I wanted to try Xyzal. I usually take my meds at night, about 2 hours after taking this medicine I got super dizzy, enough to not want to drive. (Now this is on me, should have read the packet ingredients and instructions) I can't take Cetirizine because I get ungodly drowsy, but after taking the medicine I realized its part of that family. It made me dizzy, dry mouth and really tired. Should have read one here first, this was my first time ever trying it. I know you're supposed to take allergy medicine for 2 weeks to get used to it but these side effects are a little too much for me.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I took Xyzal in the evening as directed, and I was so sleepy the next morning that I could barely get out of bed.  During the day, the effects didn't wear off until late in the day, so it compromised my ability to focus at work.  I know that it doesn't affect everyone that way, but for me, I cannot use this product.  It did reduce my allergies, but the sleepiness and brain fog it caused are intolerable unless you plan on staying in bed all day.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have terrible year round allergies. I was taking Benedryl but it triggers migraines. So, I decided to try Xyzal. It worked great on my allergies but the side effects are horrible! After about two weeks, I noticed heart palpitations that would get worse each day I took it. Then the chest pain, heart burn, and edema in my lower extremities started. I quit taking Xyzal and went back to Zyrtec. I should have known taking something in the same family would still cause problems. I took Zyrtec for four days. The palpitations and chest pain started up again and I had a bronchospasm. I was gasping for breath last night.I emailed the company that produces Xyzal and asked about these side effects. I was told they have no information.
Xyzal (levocetirizine):I take 1/2 tablet in the morning.  I am very sensitive to drugs and this is the only one of many that causes no bad side effects.  It’s a keeper!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):As many allergy sufferers know- I get so sick from allergies at the end of summer, so bad, you feel sick, so I usually take a Benadryl in the late evening, it helps, but does make me sleepy so I avoid it during the day!  Thought oh I'll try Xyzal - it would be so nice to not suffer in the day too - whoa... me, too- among those suffering heart palpitations on it! Not good! wow... I will NOT be using it.  I'm 66 and don't want to invite any trouble!    Oh it DID work to ease the allergy symptoms very nice, but not worth the risk cause of how it did effect my heart.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Took half a pill of Xyzal as my regular dose at bedtime. Next day in afternoon I’d have to take a nap. I NEVER nap. Felt like I was hit with a ton of bricks. This was happening regularly while on half a pill, and always the next afternoon. Went off it for a while, no drowsiness. Allergies acted up again so I started it again last night. Could not stay awake this afternoon. Slept 3-5pm. I’m throwing this stuff away.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I started this medication Xyzal due to chronic sinusitis and insane pressure headaches. The next day I felt extremely jittery but just shook it off, the day after (so 2 days after starting this med) I had a crazy panic attack hit me. I had immense chest pain, SOB, tingling all over my whole body, extremely light headed , I was sure I was going to pass out and uncontrollable shivering. I stopped it but now my DR wants me to restart it again see what happens since I was also started on a new med with it the first time... but since reading these comments idk seems to be a pretty usual side effect and I did not like that feeling at all ! Only good thing was I usually have trouble sleeping and that first night I slept the whole night lol

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I started taking it about two weeks ago and it made me super sleepy. Then I started to take it @ night and I would wake up with heart palpitations. I have had indigestion and chest tightness. I’m going back to my old faithful, Claritin.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Felt very groggy. Hard to wake up. After 2 days experienced, chest tightness. shortness of breath and heart palpitations.  Stopped  for a few days and restarted. Same symptoms came back.

I've been suffering from allergies manifested mostly in the eyes.  Always  tearing and watering for years.  Ophthalmologist always prescribed different eye drops.  Took this medication levocetirizine  which was prescribed to my wife by her ENT and it has worked fantastically.  Cleared up my eyes with one pill taken 3 days ago and no side effects.  Rate it a 10 for my condition...

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Took half a pill for my hay fever every few days and it worked well in the beginning but after a few times it began to wear off too quickly and it also made me more and more drowsy/sleepy. Knocks me out.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have been on Xyzal for a few years now for seasonal allergies. I am on the 5mg dosage. I take at night 20 mins before I go to bed and I sleep like a baby. When I wake, I have allergy relief all day: no runny nose, itchy eyes, sneezing and hives during ragweed season.  When my allergies are not bad.... I cut back to a half pill and it keeps my sinuses clear and if I come across a friend’s dog or cat, the small dose in my system keeps me in good shape in those situations too. It definitely works for me. The only cons for me are: sometimes a dry mouth and it will make you sleepy if you take during the day.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have severe sinusitus and take Allegra D and Zyrtec. I wake up every night not being able to breath or sleep. So I figured I’d try Zyzal it helped ease the breathing a little the first tine I tried it but I still woken at 4:30am and the next day I took it couldn’t breath and woke at 2am. Nose still full of mucus, sneezing like crazy. This product didn’t work for me
Xyzal (levocetirizine):Works ,but makes me feel sedated feeling the next day

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Although the 2 days I took the medication for allergies ( which it worked great for) , I couldn’t deal with the mental and emotional side effects it caused. The medication caused me to be mean and angry, and extremely depressed. I cried on and off the entire second day. Fortunately I was quick to recognize that these feeling were caused by the medication and after the second day off of it I was fine.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I took this 19 hours ago.  I’m still too sedated to safely drive and too unsteady to stand in the shower.  Plus my eyes are itching from allergy.  This stuff should be pulled off the market immediately!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):This is terrible. It's like taking nothing at all and I didn't realize the side effect of anxiety/depression.  That explains a lot! Going off in search of something else. I'm stuffed up all freaking day.
I've been told by at least two doctors that levocetirizine is for hives and skin type reactions to allergies and not so much for sinus and rhinos

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I'm 90% allergic to dogs and 95% allergic to cats. Guess what? I have a cat and a dog... the dog sheds more than the cat, but if the cat scratches me I break out into hives/welt. If a dog hair gets on my face, especially around my eyes... I get symptoms of pink eye. My eyes get red, itchy and swollen. That being said nothing but XYZAL has worked for me. I take this at night about 1 hour before bedtime.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Slept all day after taking it, felt groggy and horrible.  Like taking 3 or 4 Benadryl at once.  Will never take xyzal again, the sedation is debilitating it is so bad.  Only took one dose.  Incapacitated for the entire day.   I have never had any problem with bad reaction from drug before.  This is a bad drug!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I was hopeful that Xyzal would be the life changing allergy medicine I’ve been searching for. The first dose I took at bedtime, woke up to less allergy symptoms but as the day went on my mood went downhill... easily irritated, grumpy, depressed and crying. This is so opposite of my typical mood. Took second dose thinking it was just PMS or something, woke up dreading my day and more congested. The gloomy feeling is still there and after reading side affects I’m certain it’s the Xyzal. I don’t tolerate Zyrtec or Allegra either, but when you’re recovering from your 3rd sinus infection in 2 months you search for the best remedy. My daughter who has year round allergies took a dose at bedtime too, by morning it was as if she hadn’t taken anything. Gave her another dose (5ml) and the poor thing was exhausted at school, could barely keep her eyes open. Back to Claritin for me and Zyrtec for her. You truly have to try them all to see what works for you. This one tho is getting tossed.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Day 2, throat drainage is much better, although hasn't stopped completely. Congestion in my nose is better as well.  No problems with feeling sleepy.  Trying this to see if I can avoid deviated septum surgery after being on antibiotics for 3 months for severe sinus infection

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Took this at night while waiting on an Allegra order. It was not terribly effective on my indoor/outdoor allergies. I felt marginally less wheezy at night, but my nose was stuffed and eyes itchy the next morning.On top of that, it makes me sluggish and stupid for a solid 24 hours. Forget drinking on this pill; the alcohol will go straight to your head. Granted, the label says all of this, but these itty-bitty pills aren't effective enough to be worth it.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I found it to be about as effective as Zyrtec, but it made me extremely drowsy. I tried only a half dose each time, and could barely get out of bed the next day. It works fairly well, but for me it's not worth the side effects.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I took this medication prior to going to bed. I woke up with my head spinning. I could not function at all the very next day. It felt like it gave me the worst hangover of my life. I would rather suffer with allergies than feel exhausted and dizzy .

Xyzal (levocetirizine):OMG worst ever. I stocked up using all of the $5.00 off coupons and what a waste of money. I realize this year is double dose of pollen but this medicine didn't help. Gave me bad headaches and listless and tired.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Been prescribed xyzal for years. Just recently bought it over the counter for a cheaper price. The plus with this medication is that it helps a bit with my rhinitis and eliminates my hives completely. However, I'm now reading about drowsiness side effects others have been experiencing and wonder if this has been the cause of my fatigue.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):This medication did not seem to work any better than others I have taken, but it has made me extremely drowsy. I was not feeling well when I started taking it, so it took me a full week to figure out the XYZAL was making me so tired. I do not recommend this drug if you are susceptible to drowsiness side effects. Since it is sold in a 24-hour pill, I'm stuck being sleepy for a long time until this pill is out of my system.
Xyzal (levocetirizine):Really tired and sleepy throughout the day.  I take medicine. In the evening.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Really developed horrible allergies in last four years because of being over 40 living in terrible city for allergies.  It really has been a game changer for me. It's strong enough that I often just use half a pill. I do think it's better than the OTC competition. No side effects for me.

After three sinus infections in a year my doctor decided to try this drug. How I wish I'd never taken that first pill. Two weeks after I started this 5mg dose, I noticed I couldn't smell cinnamon pine cones. A week later I no longer could taste food. It has been over a year and a visit to a ENT says I won't ever be able to taste or smell again. I want everyone including physicians to know if I knew that I would never have the ability to taste and smell I would have never taken this drug. There are 51 reported cases of this drug doing this to humans, guess I'm number 52.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):This medication has changed my son's life! He was always on multiple medications for asthma and allergies year round and nothing ever truly worked. This medicine is the only one he takes now and he is 100% symptom free of allergies, sinus issues, and asthma flare ups. Very grateful for this medication!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):My doctor prescribed xyzal after my regular allergy medicine became ineffective and I was continually getting sinus infections over a couple month span.  I couldn't figure out why I was still showing allergy symptoms and continuing to get sinus infections while taking xyzal.  I decided to stop taking the medication after reading some side effects included sinus pressure, stuffy nose, and cough.  Within a few days of stopping the medication, my symptoms disappeared.  I found it interesting that some of side effects I experienced was the reason I began taking this prescription in the first place.

This has worked very well for treating my allergies. However, the side effects have hit me very hard. I normally cycle 40-60 miles on the weekends with 2 25 milers during the week. Since starting this pill I have had an enormous loss of strength, even feel tired and groggy all day. I am not sleeping very well either. My legs have been cramping really bad while exercising and cycling, I cannot ride over 30 miles without my legs locking up. I will be asking my ENT for something different tomorrow. Be aware that the side effects don't get everyone, they just got to me.Thanks!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I had been on Allegra for allergies for almost 10 years. This year it stopped working and began to make my heart race. I also developed new allergies (to foods). My general practitioner mentioned Xyzal to me, gave me some samples, and instructed me to start out with the pediatric dose 2.5mg to see how I reacted to the medicine and how effective it was for me. All I can say is, it's AWESOME! It is fast acting, stopping the itchy nose, throat, ears and non-stop sneezing soon after taking it. No crazy heart rhythms, hung over feelings, or depression with this antihistamine. It's a keeper!

I tried other allergy medicines like Zyrtec, but none of them had any effect on my itchy eyes.  Xyzal is great for me because it treated the usual Hay Fever symptoms, as well as the itchy eyes.  Taking it at night, as recommended, seems to help reduce the drowsy side effect from bothering me in the day.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have tried everything for seasonal allergies and also have been on numerous antibiotics for infections. I have been taking Xyzal for about a month now and it's the best medicine that I have ever tried. I am almost 99% allergy free. Also, most people have said that they have had weight gain. NOT ME, I HAVE HAD WEIGHT LOSS of about 4 lbs. I always react the opposite way to medicine anyway.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I was sick with sinus and ear problems for 6 weeks. I had been treated with Keflex, Zithromax, Levaquin, Allegra, Claritin and Veramyst. Some of these even made my symptoms worse. I took my first Xyxal and two hours later my sinus drainage was fine. In eight hours the sinus headache and eye redness was gone.  By the end of my second day on Xyzal, I noticed my ear canals and skin no longer itched. I had no idea this was a condition caused by allergies. I thought I had dry skin. I still have some "stuffed up" sinus issues on my fourth day but I can taste food, inhale and exhale freely through my nose and feel pretty "normal". IT WORKS!

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have had a headache for four weeks with no other symptoms. Had tried other allergy medicines but they did not work. Within a matter of hours my headache started to fade after my doctor gave me Xyzal. I didn't even think the headache was allergy related until then. Feels so good.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have been very sick with allergies. I have had breathing treatments and the like. Tried all the standard antihistamines and they did nothing. I have only been on Xyzal about a week and I am breathing again and feel like I am going to live. This has been great. And the sleep is not bad either.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have been taking Xyzal for nearly 1 year now and it truly has been my life saver.  I suffer from extreme seasonal allergies and indoor allergies with all the symptoms; itchy red eyes, itchy ears and feet, sneezing 5  times an hour, congested sinuses, headaches, congestion, hives, and frequent bloody noses.  I tried over-the-counter and prescription drugs for nearly 10 years with no success.  Xyzal has honestly relieved all my symptoms.  I take my dose before bed because it does make me sleepy.  I have no problems making it through my work day.  I do have a little bit of a dry throat side effect, but that is nothing compared to the misery I was in before.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I think this drug is probably the best thing for people with severe allergies. I tried EVERYTHING before XYZAL and I finally stumbled upon this through my doctor and I am so happy I did. Now I can actually wake up and go through the day without sneezing, coughing, or getting a head cold.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):Incredible results. I have recently developed horrible fall allergies with the whole - sneezing, runny/stuff nose, watery/itchy eyes, cough, fatigue and everything else. I would need a new tissue every 5 minutes. I took one Xyzal at 5 PM on Tuesday and it cleared every single thing up. It didn't begin to fade until 12 AM on Wednesday. I absolutely love this little pill.
Xyzal (levocetirizine):It works.
Xyzal (levocetirizine):A very good medicine. Results in two days.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I have had chronic allergies and nothing has helped.  It would be normal for me to go through a box of kleenex in a week.  The major frustration with my allergies was my itchy feet and ear canals.  Although xyzal is very expensive (my insurance doesn't cover it) it is worth not having the itchy feet and ears that no one thought about.
Xyzal (levocetirizine):Dried up the sinuses pretty well and helped me sleep
Xyzal (levocetirizine):Controls my allergies better than anything I have taken.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I love it. My doctor advised me, it's best to take right before bed. I get extremely tired 10 to 15 minutes after I take Xzyal. I also have to sleep for more than 8 hours, if I don't sleep more than 8 hours I feel drowsy all day and feel the need to take a nap.

I was having 2 to 3 sinus headaches per week and my doctor suggested I this allergy medication.  I have never regretted it. So far I have had only 2 sinus headaches in the past 4 months that I have been taking it.  It is expensive but well worth the price of being virtually headache free.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):It is a very positive medication for severe allergies. I have tried everything OTC and prescription. This a first that allows me to sleep, without getting up 5 or 6 times a night because of my nose.

Xyzal (levocetirizine):I picked this drug up from a pharmacy in Europe and LOVED IT !Of course here (in the USA) U need a Rx but, its well worth it! Love it! Better than Allegra, Claritin or anything else I've tried so far! And my allergies on a scale of 1 -10 are a 12~

Xyzal (levocetirizine):This is the best med for Allergies ever!  It will cause some sleepiness, so I wait until I'm at work, take the XYZAL, and drink one cup of coffee. Talk to your allergist about this stuff!
